form.label: Problem Detection
form.description: This Dashboard will help to get a first idea where to look at in the Wireshark trace!

search.query: index=* sourcetype=pcap:csv NOT source=*pcap2csv.sh NOT source=*pcap2csv.bat| rex field=source "SplunkForPCAP(\\\\|\/)PCAPcsv(\\\\|\/)(?<source>.*)" |stats count by source

html.p: This panel shows the maximum delta time by packet number (Top 10). It might be helpful if you look for delays in a communication!

chart.title: Delta time (sec) by packet number : tcp-stream

search.query: index=* sourcetype=pcap:csv $Source$ "$IP1$" AND "$IP2$" AND "$Port1$" AND "$Port2$" NOT FIN NOT RST NOT "TCP Keep-Alive"| eval p_s=packet_number+":"+tcp_stream| timechart span=$Span$ max(delta_time) by p_s useother=f

html.p: This panel shows the maximum duration of a tcp stream over time. It can be helpful to understand how long a tcp stream is alive!

search.query: index=* sourcetype=pcap:csv $Source$ "$IP1$" AND "$IP2$" AND "$Port1$" AND "$Port2$" | timechart span=$Span$ max(relative_time) by tcp_stream useother=f

html.p: This panel shows the tcp errors by tcp-stream. It is helpful to see directly which stream could be the problematic one!

search.query: index=* sourcetype=pcap:csv $Source$ "$IP1$" AND "$IP2$" AND "$Port1$" AND "$Port2$" (info=*retran* OR info=*zero* OR info=*Port*re*used* OR info=*window* OR info=*update*) NOT info=*continuation* NOT info="*#*" NOT "retransmission?" | rex "^[^\[\n]*\[(?P<tcp_error>[^\]]+)" | rename tcp_stream as "tcp-stream" |contingency "tcp-stream" tcp_error usetotal=f

html.p: This panel shows the 3-way-handshakes which did not finish successful, but shows retransmissions instead.

search.query: index=* sourcetype=pcap:csv $Source$ "$IP1$" AND "$IP2$" AND "$Port1$" AND "$Port2$" |eval Conversation=src_ip+"->"+dst_ip+":"+dst_port | transaction maxspan=5s maxevents=5 tcp_stream startswith="[SYN]" endswith="*retran*" | search linecount>1 | stats count as "Attempts" by Conversation

html.p: This panel shows the outliers in relation to the RTT. It is helpful when you filter for a specific conversation! It requires Splunk Machine Learning Toolkit!

search.query: index=* sourcetype=pcap:csv $Source$ "$IP1$" AND "$IP2$" AND "$Port1$" AND "$Port2$" |eval conversation=src_ip+"->"+dst_ip | sort 0 _time| eventstats avg(rtt) as avg stdev(rtt) as stdev | eval lowerBound=(avg-stdev*exact(2)), upperBound=(avg+stdev*exact(2)) | eval isOutlier=if('rtt' < lowerBound OR 'rtt' > upperBound, 1, 0) | table _time, "rtt", lowerBound, upperBound, isOutlier

html.p: This panel shows the outliers you see on the left panel in details!

search.query: index=* sourcetype=pcap:csv $Source$ "$IP1$" AND "$IP2$" AND "$Port1$" AND "$Port2$" |eval conversation=src_ip+"->"+dst_ip | sort 0 _time| eventstats avg(rtt) as avg stdev(rtt) as stdev | eval lowerBound=(avg-stdev*exact(2)), upperBound=(avg+stdev*exact(2)) | eval isOutlier=if('rtt' < lowerBound OR 'rtt' > upperBound, 1, 0) | table _time,packet_number,conversation, "rtt" isOutlier |where isOutlier=1 | fields - isOutlier

html.p: This panel is still a work in progress. This panel shows possible suspects where to put the focus on.

search.query: index=* sourcetype=pcap:csv $Source$ "$IP1$" AND "$IP2$" AND "$Port1$" AND "$Port2$" NOT FIN NOT RST NOT "TCP Keep-Alive" | eval case=if(dns_time>1, "DNS delay!", if(http_time>3, "HTTP delay!", if(delta_time>4, "Delta Time high!", if(rpc_time>2, "RPC delay!", if(smb2_time>2, "SMB2 delay!", if(smb_time>2, "SMB delay!", "ok"))))))|search NOT case="ok" | stats values(packet_number) as "Packet Numbers" by case | rename case as "Suspect"
